intro: Diosma cuspidata, commonly known as the narrowleaf diosma, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Diosma cuspidata thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
